member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.CV
member.summary: This class provides wrapper methods for the OpenCV C interface native functions.

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.CV.ConvertPointsHomogeneous(OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Mat)
member.summary: Convert points to/from homogeneous coordinates.
member.param: The input point array, 2xN, Nx2, 3xN, Nx3, 4xN or Nx4 (where N is the number of points). Multi-channel 1xN or Nx1 array is also acceptable.
The output point array, must contain the same number of points as the input. The dimensionality must be the same, 1 less or 1 more than the input.

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.CV.FindFundamentalMat(OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.FundamentalMatrixMethod,System.Double,System.Double,OpenCV.Net.Mat)
member.summary: Calculates the fundamental matrix from the corresponding points in two images.
member.param: Array of N points from the first image. It can be 2xN, Nx2, 3xN or Nx3 1-channel array or 1xN or Nx1 2- or 3-channel array. The point coordinates should be floating-point (single or double precision).
Array of the second image points of the same size and format as .
The output fundamental matrix or matrices. The size should be 3x3 or 9x3 (7-point method may return up to 3 matrices).
Method for computing the fundamental matrix.

The parameter is used for RANSAC. It is the maximum distance from the point to the epipolar line in pixels, beyond which the point is considered an outlier and is not used for computing the final fundamental matrix. It can be set to something like 1-3, depending on the accuracy of the point localization, image resolution and image noise.
The parameter is used for RANSAC or LMedS methods only. It specifies the desirable level of confidence (probability) that the estimated matrix is correct.

The optional output array of N elements, every element of which is set to 0 for outliers and to 1 for the other points. The array is computed only in RANSAC and LMedS methods. For other methods it is set to all 1's.
member.returns: The number of fundamental matrices found (1 or 3) or 0, if no matrix is found. Normally just one matrix is found, but in the case of 7-point algorithm the function may return up to 3 solutions (9x3 matrix that stores all 3 matrices sequentially).

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.CV.ComputeCorrespondEpilines(OpenCV.Net.Mat,System.Int32,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Mat)
member.summary: For points in one image of a stereo pair, computes the corresponding epilines in the other image.
member.param: The input points. 2xN, Nx2, 3xN or Nx3 array (where N number of points). Multi-channel 1xN or Nx1 array is also acceptable.
Index of the image (1 or 2) that contains the points.
The fundamental matrix that can be estimated using or .
The output epilines, a 3xN or Nx3 array. Each line ax + by + c = 0 is encoded by 3 numbers (a, b, c).

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.CV.CalibrateCamera2(OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Size,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.CameraCalibrationFlags)
member.summary: Finds the camera intrinsic and extrinsic parameters from several views of a calibration pattern.
member.param: The joint matrix of object points; calibration pattern features in the model coordinate space. A floating-point 3xN or Nx3 1-channel, or 1xN or Nx1 3-channel array, where N is the total number of points in all views.
The joint matrix of object point projections in the camera views. A floating-point 2xN or Nx2 1-channel, or 1xN or Nx1 2-channel array, where N is the total number of points in all views.
Integer 1xM or Mx1 vector (where M is the number of calibration pattern views) containing the number of points in each particular view. The sum of vector elements must match the size of and (=N).
Size of the image, used only to initialize the intrinsic camera matrix.
The output 3x3 floating-point camera matrix A = [fx 0 cx; 0 fy cy; 0 0 1].
The output 4x1, 1x4, 5x1 or 1x5 vector of distortion coefficients (k1, k2, p1, p2[, k3]).

The output 3xM or Mx3 1-channel, or 1xM or Mx1 3-channel array of rotation vectors (see ), estimated for each pattern view. That is, each k-th rotation vector together with the corresponding k-th translation vector (see the next output parameter description) brings the calibration pattern from the model coordinate space (in which object points are specified) to the world coordinate space, i.e. real position of the calibration pattern in the k-th pattern view (k=0..M-1)
The output 3xM or Mx3 1-channel, or 1xM or Mx1 3-channel array of translation vectors, estimated for each pattern view.
Specifies various operation flags.
member.returns: The final re-projection error.

Integer 1xM or Mx1 vector (where M is the number of calibration pattern views) containing the number of points in each particular view. The sum of vector elements must match the size of and (=N).
Size of the image, used only to initialize the intrinsic camera matrix.
The output 3x3 floating-point camera matrix A = [fx 0 cx; 0 fy cy; 0 0 1].
The output 4x1, 1x4, 5x1 or 1x5 vector of distortion coefficients (k1, k2, p1, p2[, k3]).

The output 3xM or Mx3 1-channel, or 1xM or Mx1 3-channel array of rotation vectors (see ), estimated for each pattern view. That is, each k-th rotation vector together with the corresponding k-th translation vector (see the next output parameter description) brings the calibration pattern from the model coordinate space (in which object points are specified) to the world coordinate space, i.e. real position of the calibration pattern in the k-th pattern view (k=0..M-1)
The output 3xM or Mx3 1-channel, or 1xM or Mx1 3-channel array of translation vectors, estimated for each pattern view.
Specifies various operation flags.
Termination criteria for the iterative optimization algorithm.
member.returns: The final re-projection error.

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.CV.StereoRectify(OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Size,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.Mat,OpenCV.Net.StereoRectificationFlags,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes rectification transforms for each head of a calibrated stereo camera.
member.param: The first camera matrix.
The second camera matrix.
The input distortion coefficients for the first camera.
The input distortion coefficients for the second camera.
Size of the image used for stereo calibration.
The rotation matrix between the 1st and the 2nd cameras’ coordinate systems.
The translation vector between the cameras’ coordinate systems.
The output 3x3 rectification transform (rotation matrix) for the first camera.
The output 3x3 rectification transform (rotation matrix) for the second camera.
The output 3x4 projection matrix for the first camera in the new (rectified) coordinate system.
The output 3x4 projection matrix for the second camera in the new (rectified) coordinate system.
The output 4x4 disparity-to-depth mapping matrix, see .
The operation flags.

The free scaling parameter. If it is -1, the function performs some default scaling. Otherwise the parameter should be between 0 and 1. 0 means that the rectified images will be zoomed and shifted so that only valid pixels are visible (i.e. there will be no black areas after rectification). 1 means that the rectified image will be decimated and shifted so that all the pixels from the original images from the cameras are retained in the rectified images, i.e. no source image pixels are lost.

The input distortion coefficients for the second camera.
Size of the image used for stereo calibration.
The rotation matrix between the 1st and the 2nd cameras’ coordinate systems.
The translation vector between the cameras’ coordinate systems.
The output 3x3 rectification transform (rotation matrix) for the first camera.
The output 3x3 rectification transform (rotation matrix) for the second camera.
The output 3x4 projection matrix for the first camera in the new (rectified) coordinate system.
The output 3x4 projection matrix for the second camera in the new (rectified) coordinate system.
The output 4x4 disparity-to-depth mapping matrix, see .
The operation flags.

The free scaling parameter. If it is -1, the function performs some default scaling. Otherwise the parameter should be between 0 and 1. 0 means that the rectified images will be zoomed and shifted so that only valid pixels are visible (i.e. there will be no black areas after rectification). 1 means that the rectified image will be decimated and shifted so that all the pixels from the original images from the cameras are retained in the rectified images, i.e. no source image pixels are lost.

The new image resolution after rectification. By default, i.e. when (0,0) is passed, it is set to the original . Setting it to larger value can help you to preserve details in the original image, especially when there is big radial distortion.

member.summary: Computes rectification transform for uncalibrated stereo camera.
member.param: Array of N points from the first image.It can be 2xN, Nx2, 3xN or Nx3 1-channel array or 1xN or Nx1 2- or 3-channel array. The point coordinates should be floating-point (single or double precision).
Array of the second image points of the same size and format as .
The input fundamental matrix. It can be computed from the same set of point pairs using .
Size of the image.
The output rectification homography matrix for the first camera.
The output rectification homography matrix for the second camera.

The optional threshold used to filter out the outliers. If the parameter is greater than zero, then all the point pairs that do not comply the epipolar geometry well enough are rejected prior to computing the homographies. Otherwise, all the points are considered inliers.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the rectification transform was computed successfully.

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.CV.ReprojectImageTo3D(OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.Mat,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reprojects disparity image to 3D space.

The output 3-channel floating-point image of the same size as disparity . Each element of image3d(x,y) will contain the 3D coordinates of the point (x,y), computed from the disparity map.
The 4x4 perspective transformation matrix that can be obtained with .
If true, the pixels with the minimal disparity (which correspond to the outliers; see ) will be transformed to 3D points with some very large Z value (currently set to 10000).

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.CV.Split(OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.Arr)
member.summary: Divides a multi-channel array into several single-channel arrays or extracts a single channel from the array.
member.param: The source array.
The first destination channel array.
The second destination channel array.
The third destination channel array.
The fourth destination channel array.
member.remarks: The function divides a multi-channel array into separate single-channel arrays. Two modes are available for the operation. If the source array has N channels and the first N destination channels are not null, they all are extracted from the source array; if only a single destination channel of the first N is not null, this particular channel is extracted; otherwise an exception is raised. The rest of the destination channels (beyond the first N) must always be null. For an instance, with COI set can also be used to extract a single channel from the image.

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.CV.Merge(OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.Arr)
member.summary: Composes a multi-channel array from several single-channel arrays or inserts a single channel into the array.
member.param: The first input channel array.
The second input channel array.
The third input channel array.
The fourth input channel array.
The destination array.
member.remarks: The function is the opposite to . If the destination array has N channels then if the first N input channels are not null, they all are copied to the destination array; if only a single source channel of the first N is not null, this particular channel is copied into the destination array; otherwise an exception is raised. The rest of the source channels (beyond the first N) must always be null. For an instance, with COI set can also be used to insert a single channel into the image.

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.CV.MixChannels(OpenCV.Net.Arr[],OpenCV.Net.Arr[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: Copies specified channels from the input arrays to the specified channels of the output arrays. All matrices must have the same size and depth.
member.param: The input arrays.
The output arrays.

The array of index pairs, specifying which channels are copied and where. [k*2] is the 0-based index of the input channel in and [k*2+1] is the index of the output channel in . Continuous channel numbering is used, i.e. the first input channels in are indexed from 0 to src[0].Channels-1, and the second input channels are indexed from src[0].Channels to src[0].Channels + src[1].Channels-1. The same scheme is used for the output image channels. As a special case, negative output channel indices mean that the corresponding output channel is filled with zeros.
member.remarks: This function is a generalized form of and . It can be used to change the order of the planes, add/remove alpha channel, extract or insert a single plane or multiple planes, etc.

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.CV.Smooth(OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.SmoothMethod,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Smooths the image in one of several ways.
member.param: The source image.
The destination image.
Type of the smoothing.
The first parameter of the smoothing operation, the aperture width. Must be a positive odd number (e.g. 1, 3, 5, ...).

The second parameter of the smoothing operation, the aperture height. Ignored by and methods. In the case of simple scaled/non-scaled and Gaussian blur, if is zero, it is set to . Otherwise it must be a positive odd number.

In the case of a smoothing, this parameter may specify the standard deviation. If it is zero, it is calculated from the kernel size. If is not zero but and are zeros, the kernel size is calculated from .
Optionally specifies the standard deviation for the second dimension.

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.CV.HoughLines2(OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.CVHandle,OpenCV.Net.HoughLinesMethod,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Finds lines in a binary image using a Hough transform.
member.param: The 8-bit, single-channel, binary source image. In the case of a probabilistic method, the image is modified by the function.

The storage for the lines that are detected. It can be a memory storage (in this case a sequence of lines is created in the storage and returned by the function) or single row/single column matrix () of a particular type.
The Hough transform variant.
Distance resolution in pixel-related units.
Angle resolution measured in radians.
Threshold parameter. A line is returned by the function if the corresponding accumulator value is greater than .

The first method-dependent parameter. For the classical Hough transform it is not used. For the probabilistic Hough transform it is the minimum line length. For the multi-scale Hough transform it is the divisor for the distance resolution .

The second method-dependent parameter. For the classical Hough transform it is not used. For the probabilistic Hough transform it is the maximum gap between line segments lying on the same line to treat them as a single line segment (i.e. to join them). For the multi-scale Hough transform it is the divisor for the angle resolution .
member.returns: A sequence of lines in case is a memory storage.

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.CV.HoughCircles(OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.CVHandle,OpenCV.Net.HoughCirclesMethod,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds circles in a grayscale image using a Hough transform.
member.param: The 8-bit, single-channel, grayscale input image.

The storage for the circles that are detected. It can be a memory storage (in this case a sequence of circles is created in the storage and returned by the function) or single row/single column matrix () of a particular type.
The Hough transform method. Currently, only is implemented.

The inverse ratio of the accumulator resolution to the image resolution. For example, if = 1, the accumulator will have the same resolution as the input image, if = 2 the accumulator will have half as big width and height, etc.

Minimum distance between the centers of the detected circles. If the parameter is too small, multiple neighbor circles may be falsely detected in addition to a true one. If it is too large, some circles may be missed.
The first method-specific parameter. in the case of it is the higher threshold of the two passed to the canny edge detector (the lower one will be twice smaller).

The second method-specific parameter. in the case of it is the accumulator threshold at the center detection stage. The smaller it is, the more false circles may be detected. Circles, corresponding to the larger accumulator values, will be returned first.
Minimum circle radius.
Maximum circle radius.
member.returns: A sequence of lines in case is a memory storage.

The distance used for fitting.
Numerical parameter (C) for some types of distances, if 0 then some optimal value is chosen.
Sufficient accuracy for radius (distance between the coordinate origin and the line); 0.01 would be a good default.
Sufficient accuracy for angle; 0.01 would be a good default.

The output line parameters. In case of 2D fitting it is an array of 4 floats (vx, vy, x0, y0) where (vx, vy) is a normalized vector collinear to the line and (x0, y0) is some point on the line. In case of 3D fitting it is an array of 6 floats (vx, vy, vz, x0, y0, z0) where (vx, vy, vz) is a normalized vector collinear to the line and (x0, y0, z0) is some point on the line.

Array of points for which the flow needs to be found.
Array of 2D points containing the calculated new positions of the input features in the second image.
Size of the search window of each pyramid level.

Buffer for the pyramid for the first frame. If it is not null, the buffer must have a sufficient size to store the pyramid from level 1 to level ; the total size of (width + 8) * height / 3 bytes is sufficient.
The same as , for the second frame.
Array of points for which the flow needs to be found.
Array of 2D points containing the calculated new positions of the input features in the second image.
The array of affine transformation matrices for each feature point. Matrices are stored sequentially with the format m(i) = [a00, a01, a10, a11] for each feature index, i.
Size of the search window of each pyramid level.

member.summary: Estimates the optimal affine transformation between two images or two point sets.
member.param: First input 2D point set stored as a , or an image.
Second input 2D point set of the same size and the same type as , or another image.
The output optimal 2x3 affine transformation matrix.

If true, the function finds an optimal affine transformation with no additional restrictions (6 degrees of freedom). Otherwise, the class of transformations to choose from is limited to combinations of translation, rotation, and uniform scaling (5 degrees of freedom).

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.CV.CalcOpticalFlowFarneback(OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.Arr,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,OpenCV.Net.FarnebackFlowFlags)
member.summary: Computes dense optical flow using Gunnar Farneback’s algorithm.
member.param: The first 8-bit single-channel input image.
The second input image of the same size and the same type as .
The computed flow image; will have the same size as and two 32-bit floating-point channels.
Specifies the image scale (less than 1) to build the pyramids for each image. 0.5 means the classical pyramid, where each next layer is twice smaller than the previous.
The number of pyramid layers, including the initial image. 1 means that no extra layers are created and only the original images are used.
The averaging window size; The larger values increase the algorithm robustness to image noise and give more chances for fast motion detection, but yield a more blurred motion field.
The number of iterations the algorithm does at each pyramid level.

Size of the pixel neighborhood used to find polynomial expansion in each pixel. The larger values mean that the image will be approximated with smoother surfaces, yielding a more robust algorithm and a more blurred motion field. Typically, is set to 5 or 7.
Standard deviation of the Gaussian that is used to smooth derivatives that are used as a basis for the polynomial expansion. For a of 5 you can set to 1.1, while for a of 7 a good value would be 1.5.
Specifies operation flags.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.ChessboardCalibrationFlags
member.summary: Specifies available operation flags for finding chessboard corners.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ChessboardCalibrationFlags.None
member.summary: Specifies that no operation flags are active.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ChessboardCalibrationFlags.AdaptiveThreshold
member.summary: Specifies that adaptive thresholding should be used to convert the image to black and white, rather than a fixed threshold level (computed from the average image brightness).

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ChessboardCalibrationFlags.NormalizeImage
member.summary: Specifies the image gamma should be normalized with before applying fixed or adaptive thresholding.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ChessboardCalibrationFlags.FilterQuads
member.summary: Specifies that additional criteria (like contour area, perimeter, square-like shape) should be used to filter out false quads extracted at the contour retrieval stage.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ChessboardCalibrationFlags.FastCheck
member.summary: Specifies that a fast check should be run on the image that looks for chessboard corners, and shortcuts the call if none is found. This can drastically speed up the call in the degenerate condition when no chessboard is observed.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.CameraCalibrationFlags
member.summary: Specifies available operation flags for camera calibration.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CameraCalibrationFlags.None
member.summary: Specifies that no operation flags are active.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CameraCalibrationFlags.UseIntrinsicGuess
member.summary: Specifies that some or all of the intrinsic parameters should be optimized according to the specified flags. Initial values are provided by the user.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CameraCalibrationFlags.FixAspectRatio
member.summary: Specifies that the function considers only fy as a free parameter. The ratio fx/fy stays the same as in the input camera matrix . When is not set, the actual input values of fx and fy are ignored; only their ratio is computed and used further.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CameraCalibrationFlags.FixPrincipalPoint
member.summary: Specifies that the principal point is not changed during the global optimization. It stays at the center or at a different location specified when is set too.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CameraCalibrationFlags.ZeroTangentialDistortion
member.summary: Specifies that tangential distortion coefficients (p1, p2) are set to zeros and stay zero.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CameraCalibrationFlags.FixFocalLength
member.summary: Specifies that the focal length (fx, fy) is not changed during the optimization.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CameraCalibrationFlags.FixK1
member.summary: Specifies that the k1 radial distortion coefficient is not changed during the optimization. If is set, the coefficient from the supplied coefficients matrix is used. Otherwise, it is set to 0.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CameraCalibrationFlags.FixK2
member.summary: Specifies that the k2 radial distortion coefficient is not changed during the optimization. If is set, the coefficient from the supplied coefficients matrix is used. Otherwise, it is set to 0.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CameraCalibrationFlags.FixK3
member.summary: Specifies that the k3 radial distortion coefficient is not changed during the optimization. If is set, the coefficient from the supplied coefficients matrix is used. Otherwise, it is set to 0.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CameraCalibrationFlags.FixK4
member.summary: Specifies that the k4 radial distortion coefficient is not changed during the optimization. If is set, the coefficient from the supplied coefficients matrix is used. Otherwise, it is set to 0.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CameraCalibrationFlags.FixK5
member.summary: Specifies that the k5 radial distortion coefficient is not changed during the optimization. If is set, the coefficient from the supplied coefficients matrix is used. Otherwise, it is set to 0.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CameraCalibrationFlags.FixK6
member.summary: Specifies that the k6 radial distortion coefficient is not changed during the optimization. If is set, the coefficient from the supplied coefficients matrix is used. Otherwise, it is set to 0.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CameraCalibrationFlags.RationalModel
member.summary: Coefficients k4, k5, and k6 are enabled. To provide the backward compatibility, this extra flag should be explicitly specified to make the calibration function use the rational model and return 8 coefficients. If the flag is not set, the function computes and returns only 5 distortion coefficients.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.StereoCalibrationFlags
member.summary: Specifies available operation flags for stereo camera calibration.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.StereoCalibrationFlags.None
member.summary: Specifies that no operation flags are active.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.StereoCalibrationFlags.UseIntrinsicGuess
member.summary: Specifies that some or all of the intrinsic parameters should be optimized according to the specified flags. Initial values are provided by the user.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.StereoCalibrationFlags.FixAspectRatio
member.summary: Specifies that the function considers only fy as a free parameter. The ratio fx/fy stays the same as in the input camera matrix . When is not set, the actual input values of fx and fy are ignored; only their ratio is computed and used further.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.StereoCalibrationFlags.FixPrincipalPoint
member.summary: Specifies that the principal point is not changed during the global optimization. It stays at the center or at a different location specified when is set too.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.StereoCalibrationFlags.ZeroTangentialDistortion
member.summary: Specifies that tangential distortion coefficients (p1, p2) are set to zeros and stay zero.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.StereoCalibrationFlags.FixFocalLength
member.summary: Specifies that the focal length (fx, fy) is not changed during the optimization.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.StereoCalibrationFlags.FixK1
member.summary: Specifies that the k1 radial distortion coefficient is not changed during the optimization. If is set, the coefficient from the supplied coefficients matrix is used. Otherwise, it is set to 0.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.StereoCalibrationFlags.FixK2

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.StereoCalibrationFlags.FixK3
member.summary: Specifies that the k3 radial distortion coefficient is not changed during the optimization. If is set, the coefficient from the supplied coefficients matrix is used. Otherwise, it is set to 0.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.StereoCalibrationFlags.FixIntrinsic
member.summary: Specifies that the camera matrix and distortion coefficients should not be changed, so that only R, T, E and F matrices are estimated.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.StereoCalibrationFlags.SameFocalLength
member.summary: Specifies the constraint that both cameras should have the same focal length (fx, fy).

Specifies operation flags associated with the new file storage.

Not used in the current implementation.

If true, the written string is put in quotes, regardless of whether they are required. Otherwise, if the flag is zero, quotes are used only when they are required (e.g. when the string starts with a digit or contains spaces).

member.summary: Represents a cascade or tree of boosted Haar stage classifiers.

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.HaarClassifierCascade.Load(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a boosted Haar classifier cascade from a file. This method ensures that all dependencies are loaded and is a temporary workaround to ensure does not throw an error.
member.param: The path to the trained classifier cascade.
member.returns: A new instance of the class.

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.HaarClassifierCascade.DetectObjects(OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.MemStorage,System.Double,System.Int32,OpenCV.Net.HaarDetectObjectFlags,OpenCV.Net.Size,OpenCV.Net.Size)
member.summary: Detects objects in the image.
member.param: Image to detect objects in.
Memory storage to store the resultant sequence of the object candidate rectangles.
The factor by which the search window is scaled between the subsequent scans, 1.1 means increasing window by 10%.

Minimum number (minus 1) of neighbor rectangles that make up an object. All the groups of a smaller number of rectangles than -1 are rejected. If it is 0, the method does not do any grouping at all and returns all the detected candidate rectangles, which may be useful if the user wants to apply a customized grouping procedure.
Mode of operation.
Minimum window size. By default, it is set to the size of samples the classifier has been trained on (20x20 for face detection).
Maximum window size. By default, it is set to the total image size.
member.returns: The sequence of grouped (or ungrouped) object rectangles.

member.summary: Executes the code required to free the native handle.

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.KalmanFilter.StatePredicted
member.summary: Gets the predicted state vector (x'(k)): x'(k) = A * x(k - 1) + B * u(k).

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.KalmanFilter.StateCorrected
member.summary: Gets the corrected state vector (x(k)): x(k) = x'(k) + K(k) * (z(k) - H * x'(k))

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.KalmanFilter.TransitionMatrix
member.summary: Gets the state transition matrix (A).

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.KalmanFilter.ControlMatrix
member.summary: Gets the control matrix (B). Not used if there is no control.

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.KalmanFilter.MeasurementMatrix
member.summary: Gets the measurement matrix (H).

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.KalmanFilter.ProcessNoiseCovariance
member.summary: Gets the process noise covariance matrix (Q).

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.KalmanFilter.MeasurementNoiseCovariance
member.summary: Gets the measurement noise covariance matrix (R).

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.KalmanFilter.ErrorCovariancePrior
member.summary: Gets the prior error estimate covariance matrix (P'(k)): P'(k) = A * P(k - 1) * At + Q.

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.KalmanFilter.Gain
member.summary: Gets the Kalman gain matrix (K(k)): K(k) = P'(k) * Ht * inv(H * P'(k) * Ht + R).

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.KalmanFilter.ErrorCovariancePosterior
member.summary: Gets the posterior error estimate covariance matrix (P(k)): P(k) = (I - K(k) * H) * P'(k).

member.summary: Returns the size of a particular array dimension.
member.param: The zero-based dimension index. For matrices, zero means number of rows and one means number of columns; for images zero means height and one means width.
member.returns: The number of elements in a particular array dimension.

member.returns: The pointer to the array element specified by .
member.remarks: This method can be used for sequential access to 1D, 2D or nD dense arrays. The method can be used for sparse arrays as well; if the requested node does not exist, it is created and set to zero.

member.summary: Checks that every array element is neither NaN nor Infinity. It can also check whether the elements are within a specified range.

The exclusive upper boundary of valid values range.
member.returns: true if all array elements are valid and within range; false otherwise.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.StereoBM
member.summary: Represents the block matching algorithm for computing stereo correspondence.

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.StereoBM.#ctor(OpenCV.Net.StereoBMPreset,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified parameter and .
member.param: Specifies the whole set of algorithm parameters.
The disparity search range. For each pixel algorithm will find the best disparity from 0 (default minimum disparity) to . The search range can then be shifted by changing the minimum disparity.

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.StereoBM.FindStereoCorrespondence(OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.Arr,OpenCV.Net.Arr)
member.summary: Computes the disparity map using block matching algorithm.
member.param: The left single-channel, 8-bit image.
The right image of the same size and the same type.

The output single-channel 16-bit signed, or 32-bit floating-point disparity map of the same size as input images. In the first case the computed disparities are represented as fixed-point numbers with 4 fractional bits (i.e. the computed disparity values are multiplied by 16 and rounded to integers).

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.StereoBM.ReleaseHandle
member.summary: Executes the code required to free the native handle.
member.returns: true if the handle is released successfully; otherwise, in the event of a catastrophic failure, false.

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.StereoBM.PreFilterType
member.summary: Gets or sets the block matching pre-filter type.

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.StereoBM.PreFilterSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the pre-filter averaging window size. Must be odd.

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.StereoBM.PreFilterCap
member.summary: Gets or sets the cap for pre-filtering. The output is clipped to be within [-PreFilterCap,PreFilterCap].

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.StereoBM.SadWindowSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the Sum of Absolute Differences window size. Must be odd.

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.StereoBM.MinDisparity
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum disparity (can be negative).

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.StereoBM.NumberOfDisparities
member.summary: Gets or sets the difference between the maximum disparity and minimum disparity.

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.StereoBM.TextureThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the texture threshold. The disparity is only computed for pixels with textured enough neighborhood.

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.StereoBM.UniquenessRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the uniqueness ratio. The computed computed disparity d* should only be accepted if SAD(d) >= SAD(d*)*(1 + uniquenessRatio/100) for any d != d*+/-1 within the search range.

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.StereoBM.SpeckleWindowSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the disparity variation window.

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.StereoBM.SpeckleRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the acceptable range of variation in window.

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.StereoBM.TrySmallerWindows
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use smaller windows. The results may be more accurate, at the expense of slower processing.

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.StereoBM.Roi1
member.summary: Gets or sets the clipping ROI for the left image.

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.StereoBM.Roi2
member.summary: Gets or sets the clipping ROI for the right image.

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.StereoBM.Disparity12MaxDiff
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed difference between the explicitly computed left-to-right disparity map and the implicitly computed right-to-left disparity. If for some pixel the difference is larger than the specified threshold, the disparity at the pixel is invalidated. By default this parameter is set to (-1), which means that the left-right check is not performed.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CaptureProperty.OpenNIRegistrationOn
member.summary: Specifies that the flag is "on".

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CaptureProperty.OpenNIApproxFrameSync
member.summary: Specifies whether the depth generator should be approximately synchronized with the image generator.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CaptureProperty.OpenNIMaxBufferSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum buffer size for generator synchronization.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CaptureProperty.OpenNICircleBuffer
member.summary: Specifies whether the synchronization buffer is circular.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CaptureProperty.OpenNIMaxTimeDuration
member.summary: Specifies the maximum time difference to consider depth and image frame to be in sync.

member.summary: Specifies a flag that is used to check whether a given OpenNI generator is present.

member.summary: Specifies whether an image generator is present.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CaptureProperty.OpenNIImageGeneratorOutputMode
member.summary: Specifies the output mode of the OpenNI image generator.

member.summary: Specifies the depth sensor baseline value, in mm.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.CaptureProperty.OpenNIDepthGeneratorRegistrationOn
member.summary: Specifies that the flag is "on".

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.SmoothMethod
member.summary: Specifies the type of smoothing used by .

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.SmoothMethod.BlurNoScale
member.summary: Specifies a linear convolution with size1 x size2 box kernel (all 1’s). If you want to smooth different pixels with different-size box kernels, you can use the integral image that is computed using .

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.SmoothMethod.Blur
member.summary: Specifies a linear convolution with size1 x size2 box kernel (all 1’s) with subsequent scaling by 1 / (size1 x size2).

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.SmoothMethod.Gaussian
member.summary: Specifies a linear convolution with a size1 x size2 Gaussian kernel.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.SmoothMethod.Median
member.summary: Specifies a median filter with a size1 x size2 square aperture.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.SmoothMethod.Bilateral
member.summary: Specifies a bilateral filter with a size1 x size2 square aperture, color sigma = sigma1 and spatial sigma = sigma2.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.PyramidDecompositionFilter
member.summary: Specifies the type of linear filter used for pyramid up and downsampling.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.PyramidDecompositionFilter.Gaussian5x5
member.summary: Specifies a 5x5 gaussian filter.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.SubPixelInterpolation
member.summary: Specifies the interpolation method used by .

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.SubPixelInterpolation.NearestNeighbor
member.summary: Specifies a nearest-neighbor interpolation.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.SubPixelInterpolation.Linear
member.summary: Specifies a bilinear interpolation.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.SubPixelInterpolation.Cubic
member.summary: Specifies a bicubic interpolation over a 4x4 pixel neighborhood.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.SubPixelInterpolation.Area
member.summary: Specifies resampling using pixel area relation. It may be a preferred method for image decimation, as it gives moire’-free results. Similar to when image is zoomed.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.SubPixelInterpolation.Lanczos4
member.summary: Specifies a Lanczos interpolation over an 8x8 pixel neighborhood.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.WarpFlags
member.summary: Specifies interpolation and operational flags for image warp methods.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.WarpFlags.NearestNeighbor
member.summary: Specifies a nearest-neighbor interpolation.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.WarpFlags.Linear
member.summary: Specifies a bilinear interpolation.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.WarpFlags.Cubic
member.summary: Specifies a bicubic interpolation over a 4x4 pixel neighborhood.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.WarpFlags.Area
member.summary: Specifies resampling using pixel area relation. It may be a preferred method for image decimation, as it gives moire’-free results. Similar to when image is zoomed.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.WarpFlags.Lanczos4
member.summary: Specifies a Lanczos interpolation over an 8x8 pixel neighborhood.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.WarpFlags.FillOutliers
member.summary: Specifies that all destination pixels should be filled. If some correspond to outliers in the source image, they are set to a constant value.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.WarpFlags.InverseMap
member.summary: Specifies that the map matrix is inversely transformed from the destination image to the source and can thus be used directly for pixel interpolation.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.MorphologicalOperation
member.summary: Specifies the type of morphological operation used by .

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.MorphologicalOperation.Erode
member.summary: Specifies the primitive erosion morphological operation.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.MorphologicalOperation.Dilate
member.summary: Specifies the primitive dilation morphological operation.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.MorphologicalOperation.Open
member.summary: Specifies a morphological operation performed by first eroding and then dilating the image.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.MorphologicalOperation.Close
member.summary: Specifies a morphological operation performed by first dilating and then eroding the image.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.MorphologicalOperation.Gradient
member.summary: Specifies a morphological operation obtained by subtracting the result of the operator from the result of the operator.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.MorphologicalOperation.TopHat
member.summary: Specifies a morphological operation obtained by subtracting the result of the operator from the input image.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.MorphologicalOperation.BlackHat
member.summary: Specifies a morphological operation obtained by subtracting the input image from the result of the operator.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.StructuringElementShape
member.summary: Specifies the shape of the structuring element kernel.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.StructuringElementShape.Rectangle
member.summary: Specifies a rectangular structuring element.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.StructuringElementShape.Cross
member.summary: Specifies a cross-shaped structuring element.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.StructuringElementShape.Ellipse
member.summary: Specifies an elliptical structuring element.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.StructuringElementShape.Custom
member.summary: Specifies a user-defined structuring element. In this case the kernel values are passed explicitly to the constructor method.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.TemplateMatchingMethod
member.summary: Specifies the way the template is compared with image regions in .

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.TemplateMatchingMethod.SquareDifference
member.summary: Specifies that the sum of squared differences between region and template will be used.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.TemplateMatchingMethod.SquareDifferenceNormed
member.summary: Specifies that the normed sum of squared differences between region and template will be used.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.TemplateMatchingMethod.CrossCorrelation
member.summary: Specifies that the cross correlation between region and template will be used.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.TemplateMatchingMethod.CrossCorrelationNormed
member.summary: Specifies that the normed cross correlation between region and template will be used.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.TemplateMatchingMethod.CorrelationCoefficient
member.summary: Specifies that the correlaton coefficient between region and template will be used.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.TemplateMatchingMethod.CorrelationCoefficientNormed
member.summary: Specifies that the normed correlaton coefficient between region and template will be used.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.DistanceType
member.summary: Specifies the available types of distance functions.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.DistanceType.User
member.summary: Specifies that a user defined distance should be used.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.DistanceType.L1
member.summary: Specifies the L1 or Manhattan distance.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.DistanceType.L2
member.summary: Specifies the L2 or Euclidean distance.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.DistanceType.C
member.summary: Specifies the elementwise max distance.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.DistanceType.L12
member.summary: Specifies the L1-L2 metric.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.DistanceType.Fair
member.summary: Specifies the Fair metric given by c^2(|x|/c-log(1+|x|/c)), c = 1.3998.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.DistanceType.Welsch
member.summary: Specifies the Welsch metric given by distance = c^2/2(1-exp(-(x/c)^2)), c = 2.9846.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.DistanceType.Huber
member.summary: Specifies the Huber metric given by distance = x^2/2 if |x| is less than c, else c(|x|-c/2), c=1.345.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.ContourRetrieval
member.summary: Specifies the available contour retrieval modes.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ContourRetrieval.External
member.summary: Specifies that only the extreme outer contours should be retrieved.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ContourRetrieval.List
member.summary: Specifies that all the contours should be retrieved and stored in a list.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ContourRetrieval.ConnectedComponent
member.summary: Specifies that all the contours should be retrieved and organized into a two-level hierarchy: on the top level are the external boundaries of the components, on the second level are the boundaries of the holes.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ContourRetrieval.Tree
member.summary: Specifies that all the contours should be retrieved with the full hierarchy of nested contours.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ContourRetrieval.FloodFill
member.summary: Specifies that all the contours should be retrieved using the flood fill algorithm.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.ContourApproximation
member.summary: Specifies the available contour approximation methods.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ContourApproximation.ChainCode
member.summary: Specifies that contours should be output in the Freeman chain code.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ContourApproximation.ChainApproxNone
member.summary: Specifies that all the elements of the chain code should be translated into points.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ContourApproximation.ChainApproxSimple
member.summary: Specifies that all horizontal, vertical, and diagonal segments should be compressed, leaving only their end points.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ContourApproximation.ChainApproxTC89L1
member.summary: Specifies that Teh-Chin's L1 chain approximation algorithm should be used.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ContourApproximation.ChainApproxTC89KCos
member.summary: Specifies that Teh-Chin's K cosines chain approximation algorithm should be used.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ContourApproximation.LinkRuns
member.summary: Specifies a completely different contour retrieval algorithm by linking horizontal segments of ones. Only the retrieval mode can be used with this method.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.PolygonApproximation
member.summary: Specifies the available polygon approximation algorithms.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.PolygonApproximation.DouglasPeucker
member.summary: Specifies that the Douglas-Peucker polygon approximation algorithm should be used.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.ShapeMatchingMethod
member.summary: Specifies the available shape comparison methods.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ShapeMatchingMethod.MatchI1
member.summary: Specifies that the match should be computed as I2(A,B) = sum{i}(|1/miA - 1/miB|). mi = sign(hi).log(hi) where hi is the ith Hu moment.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ShapeMatchingMethod.MatchI2
member.summary: Specifies that the match should be computed as I2(A,B) = sum{i}(|miA - miB|). mi = sign(hi).log(hi) where hi is the ith Hu moment.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ShapeMatchingMethod.MatchI3
member.summary: Specifies that the match should be computed as I2(A,B) = sum{i}(|miA - miB| / |miA|). mi = sign(hi).log(hi) where hi is the ith Hu moment.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.ShapeOrientation
member.summary: Specifies the desired orientation of the convex hull.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ShapeOrientation.Clockwise
member.summary: Specifies that the convex hull should be oriented clockwise.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ShapeOrientation.CounterClockwise
member.summary: Specifies that the convex hull should be oriented counterclockwise.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.HistogramType
member.summary: Specifies the available histogram types.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.HistogramType.Array
member.summary: Specifies that histogram data is represented as a multi-dimensional dense array .

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.HistogramType.Sparse
member.summary: Specifies that histogram data is represented as a multi-dimensional sparse array .

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.HistogramType.Tree
member.summary: Specifies that histogram data is represented as a multi-dimensional sparse array .

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.HistogramComparison
member.summary: Specifies the available histogram comparison methods.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.HistogramComparison.Correlation
member.summary: Specifies that the histograms should be compared using a correlation measure.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.HistogramComparison.ChiSquare
member.summary: Specifies that the histograms should be compared using a chi-squared statistic.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.HistogramComparison.Intersection
member.summary: Specifies that the histograms should be compared using bin intersection.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.HistogramComparison.Bhattacharyya
member.summary: Specifies that the histograms should be compared using the Bhattacharyya distance. This method only works on normalized histograms.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.HistogramComparison.Hellinger
member.summary: Specifies that the histograms should be compared using the Bhattacharyya distance. This method only works on normalized histograms.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.ThresholdTypes
member.summary: Specifies the available threshold types.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ThresholdTypes.Binary
member.summary: Specifies that all values above threshold should be set to a fixed max value while all other values should be set to 0.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ThresholdTypes.BinaryInv
member.summary: Specifies that all values above threshold should be set to 0 while all other values should be set to a fixed max value.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ThresholdTypes.Truncate
member.summary: Specifies that all values above threshold should be set to the threshold value while all other values should be left as they are.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ThresholdTypes.ToZero
member.summary: Specifies that all values above threshold should be left as they are while all other values should be set to 0.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ThresholdTypes.ToZeroInv
member.summary: Specifies that all values above threshold should be set to 0 while all other values should be left as they are.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.ThresholdTypes.Otsu
member.summary: Specifies that the Otsu algorithm should be used to choose the optimal threshold value. Combine the flag with one of the other values.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.DistanceLabel
member.summary: Specifies the content of the output label array in .

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.DistanceLabel.ConnectedComponent
member.summary: Specifies that the content of the output label array are connected components.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.DistanceLabel.Pixel
member.summary: Specifies that the content of the output label array are pixel values.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.AdaptiveThresholdMethod
member.summary: Specifies the available adaptive threshold methods.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.AdaptiveThresholdMethod.MeanC
member.summary: Specifies that the threshold value is the mean of the pixel neighborhood minus a constant.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.AdaptiveThresholdMethod.GaussianC
member.summary: Specifies that the threshold value is the weighted sum (i.e. cross-correlation with a Gaussian window) of the pixel neighborhood minus a constant.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.FloodFillFlags
member.summary: Specifies flags for the flood fill algorithm.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.FloodFillFlags.Connected8
member.summary: Specifies the 8-connected flood fill algorithm.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.FloodFillFlags.Connected4
member.summary: Specifies the 4-connected flood fill algorithm.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.FloodFillFlags.FixedRange
member.summary: Specifies that the difference between the current pixel and seed pixel is considered for flooding. Otherwise, the difference between neighbor pixels is considered (i.e. the range is floating).

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.FloodFillFlags.MaskOnly
member.summary: Specifies that the method does not change the image but fills the mask.

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.HoughLinesMethod
member.summary: Specifies available Hough transform variants for line detection.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.HoughLinesMethod.Standard
member.summary: Classical or standard Hough transform. Every line is represented by two floating-point numbers rho and theta, where rho is a distance between (0,0) point and the line, and theta is the angle between x-axis and the normal to the line.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.HoughLinesMethod.Probabilistic
member.summary: Probabilistic Hough transform (more efficient in case the picture contains a few long linear segments). It returns line segments rather than the whole line. Each segment is represented by starting and ending points.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.HoughLinesMethod.MultiScale
member.summary: Multi-scale variant of the classical Hough transform. The lines are encoded the same way as .

member.name: T:OpenCV.Net.HoughCirclesMethod
member.summary: Specifies available Hough transform variants for circle detection.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.HoughCirclesMethod.Gradient
member.summary: Implements the 2-1 Hough Transform for circle detection.

member.summary: Represents a rectangular convolution kernel used for morphological operations.

member.name: P:OpenCV.Net.IplConvKernel.Anchor
member.summary: Gets the anchor position within the element. The default value (-1, -1) means that the anchor is at the center. Note that only the shape of a cross-shaped element depends on the anchor position. In other cases the anchor just regulates how much the result of the morphological operation is shifted.

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.NamedWindow.DisplayOverlay(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Displays text on the window’s image as an overlay for milliseconds. This is not editing the image’s data. The text is displayed on the top of the image.
member.param: Overlay text to write on the window’s image.
Delay to display the overlay text. If this method is called before the previous overlay text times out, the timer is restarted and the text updated. If this value is zero, the text never disappears.

member.name: M:OpenCV.Net.NamedWindow.DisplayStatusBar(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Displays text on the window’s status bar for milliseconds.
member.param: Text to write on the window’s status bar.
Delay to display the text. If this method is called before the previous text times out, the timer is restarted and the text updated. If this value is zero, the text never disappears.

member.name: F:OpenCV.Net.FarnebackFlowFlags.Gaussian
member.summary: Specifies that a Gaussian filter should be used instead of a box filter for optical flow estimation. Usually, this option gives more accurate flow than a box filter, at the cost of lower speed. The size of the Gaussian window should be set to a larger value to achieve the same level of robustness.
